verbose_text: In that sense, bacterial metallothioneins of the BmtA type are an exception - they contain a clearly identifiable zinc finger fold, and it has been demonstrated experimentally that the constituents of this fold (residues 7-38) form an ordered, folded structure, even if only one Zn 2+ ion is bound to SmtA.
evidence: Zn 2+  ion is bound to SmtA
